com.pump.swing

Class RenderingHintsContextMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPopupMenu
            • com.pump.swing.RenderingHintsContextMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.MenuElement

    public class RenderingHintsContextMenu
extends javax.swing.JPopupMenu
    This provides a context menu for a component that lets the user adjust the RenderingHints being used.

    This is intended as a tool for developers; not for general use.

    Note this menu cannot actually change the RenderingHints of a component unless you override the paint() method.

    For example, a possible demo of this component might look like this:

    RenderingHintsContextMenu myContextMenu = new RenderingHintsContextMenu(myComponent)
    JComponent myComponent = new JComponent() {
      public void paint(Graphics g) {
        ((Graphics2D)g).setRenderingHints(myContextMenu.getRenderingHints());
        ... paint something
      }
    };

    The component that this menu is created for will receive a call to repaint() whenever a hint is changed.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
